numbered_ace_sentences: 1. A graph shows an admission rate for applicants.
2. A graph shows an income level for applicants.
3. A graph shows whether an applicant is a legacy student.
4. If an applicant has a higher income then the applicant is more likely to be admitted.
5. Legacy students have a higher acceptance rate than non-legacy students.
6. I wonder why legacy status matters for admission.
7. I wonder how the effect of legacy status has changed over time.
8. I wonder whether this graph applies to other prestigious universities that are not Ivy League universities.
9. I am in the process of college applications.
10. The graph highlights unequal circumstances in admissions.
11. Income is a circumstance that a person does not choose.
12. Legacy status is a circumstance that a person does not choose.
13. A person is born into an income level.
14. A person is born into a legacy status.
15. These circumstances make it difficult for other students to reach the same admission rate by choice alone.
16. These circumstances make it difficult for other students to reach the same admission rate by decision alone.
17. The admission process is biased.
18. The admission process is unfair.
19. The headline is: Legacy Boost: Legacy students are more than 2 times as likely to be admitted to elite universities.
20. The headline is: The higher the income, the higher the admission rate.
